p: Melilotosides: These relatively rare compounds did show good activity against the diarrhoea-causing pathogens Entamoeba histolytica and Giardia lamblia (IC 50 = 12.5 and 16.8 μg/mL, respectively), indicating that the traditional use of A. annua for the treatment of diarrhoea might be effective (Calzada et al. 2003). No reports could be found on their activity against HIV, although these compounds will be hydrolysed into their respective o-coumaric acids in the digestive tract. The o-coumaric acids have not yet been tested against HIV, but Zhuang et al. ( 2009) have reported that they exhibit some activity against the SARS virus.
